pageContext.claim: “Nobody called me -- nobody called me from the magazine [the Atlantic] and said, 'Do you have a comment about it?' No, they just write whatever they want to write because they figure you can't get sued. You can't get sued, but it's very -- it's a very hard -- bringing lawsuits.”
pageContext.analysis: The Atlantic article did in fact contact the White House. The article laid out the interaction, "The White House did not return earlier calls for comment, but Alyssa Farah, a White House spokesperson, emailed me this statement shortly after this story was posted: 'This report is false. President Trump holds the military in the highest regard. He’s demonstrated his commitment to them at every turn: delivering on his promise to give our troops a much needed pay raise, increasing military spending, signing critical veterans reforms, and supporting military spouses. This has no basis in fact.'"
